# Linear Probability Model without Fixed Effects

## all votes, without changes
```{r}
df_no_change_1 <- df_no_change %>% select(-c(state, seniority_114, seniority_115, seniority_116, seniority_117, Dmajority_113, Dmajority_114, Dmajority_115, Dmajority_116, Dmajority_117, Geographical, seniority_113, nominate_dim1, nominate_dim2, birthday, gender))

no_change_ols_minus <- lm(all_votes_minus ~ . - all_votes_plus, data = df_no_change_1)
summary(no_change_ols_minus)
```

## each vote separately
```{r}
# Vote 3 comparison
ols_3_1 <- lm(Vote3_minus ~ . - state - BioID - Vote3_plus - Vote3 - Vote_change_dummy - Geographical - birthday - seniority_113 - nominate_dim1 - nominate_dim2, data = df_vote_3)
summary(ols_3_1)
```

## subsample analysis, only those who changed votes
```{r}
df_subsample_1 <- df_subsample %>% select(party, vote_change_to_anti, year, Contribution_3_minus, Contribution_3_plus, Contribution_4_minus, Contribution_4_plus, Contribution_51_minus, Contribution_51_plus, Contribution_52_minus, Contribution_52_plus, Contribution_6_minus, Contribution_6_plus, Contribution_7_minus, Contribution_7_plus)

ols_subsample_2 <- lm(vote_change_to_anti ~ . - year, data = df_subsample_1)
summary(ols_subsample_2)

```
